name: Mohegan Sun

reviews.title: Love the Sun. Bring back the comped rooms.
reviews.text: We stayed at Mohegan Sun for two nights beginning July 17. Had a room facing the river on the 26th floor. We love that the rooms are always consistent, nice size and beautiful bathrooms. Good soundproofing as long as you don't have an adjoining room. Door lets in lots of sound from the other room.
All staff members, from check-in to housekeeping to floor personnel, were friendly and efficient. Quite a difference from Foxwoods.
reviews.title: Had a ball, but lost my shirt!

reviews.text: We had lunch at Bobby's Burger Palace and it was great. Perfectly cooked burgers and the fries were very good although we always have to request that they not be overcooked.
reviews.title: Top-Notch Experience!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Had a chance to play Virtual Racing on Wednesday. Fun change of pace.
reviews.title: wonderful hotel but........

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My only complaint is the same as a previous reviewer. We used to get fully comped rooms. Now we were lucky to get a weekday night for $49. Very lucky since right after we booked, the same nights went to $129. We're not high rollers but we spend 12 to 14 hours a day on the floor so we cycle a lot of money through the machines. We're spoiled because we never have to pay for rooms in Atlantic City, even at Borgata.
reviews.title: Over-rated

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This was the first time I actually stayed at Mohegan Sun's hotel. Usually we stay at a hotel in the surrounding area because Mohegan Sun's hotel prices are expensive especially since you'll be gambling. We actually got a good price for a Sunday night and a free concert tickets. I guess that's because my husband has "spent" enough money at the casino!
reviews.title: Very Nice Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The room was in good condition and we had a view of the river. There were 3 phones in the room. One at the desk, one at the bedside table and one in the water closet (little room with the toilet). I liked that the toilet was separate from the sink and shower area. The bathroom vanity had 2 sinks and the shower pressure was good. Bed was comfortable too. They have a refrigerator with drinks and snacks for purchase. 2 complementary 1/2 water bottles and coffee/tea maker.
reviews.title: Another Great stay at Mohegan!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Oh and the hotel lobby smelled so nice. We would definitely stay here again if the price was right.
reviews.title: 3 stars says it all

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We just returned from our 2nd trip to Mohegan after a year brea. Finally our group is returning because they are offering decent, discounted rates. At both times we were able to check in early, about 1 pm in which the front desk was very accommodating with all our needs. We got an 30th floor room with a beautiful view of the lake. During our stay we all ate at Bubbas, Birches, Genos, and a extra special meal at Ballos. All meals were amazing we have never had a bad meal yet! Our stay was during the week so the crowd was minimal. The new Virtual Racing they offer was an added benefit if you play then slots, I even won twice, $25 free play each time! I feel like I'm walking into a 5 star hotel when we were there. The whole hotel was very clean, all employees were always helpful and courteous. Hopefully we will be going back for our anniversary in Oct. These past trips we celebrated our birthdays in style! P.s. Fireworks and party on the rooftop was so much fun also, only on Wed during the summer. Attn all woman the shopping is amazing, great sales,
reviews.title: Beautiful room and view

reviews.text: Went for the weekend with friends. I enjoy the whole ambiance of the Mohegan Sun and it's shopping area and food choices. I do a little gambling, nothing to get comped for, and would never pay the asking rate for their rooms, but since we went with friends who could get a better rate, we decided to make a weekend out of it.
reviews.title: sooo nice but soooo expensive

reviews.text: This is a great place to stay,, Only try to do it weekdays and Sunday. Great treatment by the entire staff and would stay there any time I am in the area
reviews.title: what a place

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I always love staying here. The rooms are very spacious, clean and the staff is so friendly. The pool is nice, especially in the early morning and they have a great coffee service right there, so you can enjoy the pool and your coffee at the same time.
reviews.title: So nice and relaxing

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Love the restaurants there, too, especially Bobby Flay's Steakhouse. Very, very good.
reviews.title: Very Nice....but..

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The buffet is top notch, too, especially for breakfast!
reviews.title: Had fun, nice property, a few glitches

reviews.text: The hotel is very clean, airy and open. The view from our room was beautiful and the room was spacious. We arrived at the hotel at about 1200 noon and to our delight, our room was ready. Check-in was speedy and efficient. The only caution I have about staying here, is that the walls are paper thin. At about 230 in the morning, the people in the next room came up to their room. Their voices startled me from sleep. They continued to talk and drink until 4 am. I did not call down to the front desk because, the truth is, they were only talking, they were not loud....this is why I say....walls are thin.
reviews.title: Beautiful place!

reviews.text: I love going to Mohegan Sun. This being said I was disappointed this week in the service at the hotel. I checked in with a small group and had my own room. When we got settled I tried to use the in-room safe and saw the bolt was out and the door was open. I could not reset it to get the bolt back. So I called the front desk.....waited for TWENTY minutes before I could get through and was told they would send someone up. Instead of going to the casino I waited so I could finish unpacking. After 3 hours no one had come and it was time for my group to meet for dinner. I decided to call again and after TEN minutes of trying to get through the person at the front desk apologized assured me someone would be up and I did NOT have to wait for them. I made sure the the do not disturb was NOT on and stored my items in my sister's safe in the next room. I came back from dinner around 11 and no one had been there. Needless to say I was not happy. I then decided to leave a note for the maid with my daily tip and still nothing. I basically gave up asking but to top it all off when we checked out the front desk could of cared less. They said rather non-chalantly they sorry and thank you for letting us know. Come on!! At last act like you cared.....they even lost 3 hours of me throwing my money into the casino. Not cool!
reviews.title: It could of been an Excellent rating but.....
Great quick stay and full of great perks
reviews.text: This was the trip of savings. Taking the Cross Sound Ferry was fast and easy, and they offer a mid-week promo. The room was comped, but that didn't mean we got a lesser room. The non-smoking room was immaculate, overlooked the water ( a lake with a forest behind it). The only thing that could have ben improved were the pillowsa, which were a bit on the lumpy side and too large. There was a spare but it was even larger. Other than that, ita was pretty great, a beautiful bathroom, worth hot water and a lot of water pressure. The meals were also comped as well, and that was all as a result of hours and hours of playing, and losing. But that is what gambling is about. We had a lot of fun. The TV had great options, but who goes to Mohegan Sun to stay in the room? : )

Unfortunately, I've spent so much time gambling and staying at the Sun that I think I own much of the first floor. Really! The rooms are beautiful - room service is great. Variety of restaurants is good but the food is lacking. Not what it used to be, unfortunately. However, there are a few good food venues. The casino itself is great. Lots of great machines which are constantly being updated and replaced. Very good poker machines...and a variety of them....but, it's very, very difficult to win at the Indian Casino's in CT. You don't often see anyone winning and they make a big deal out of it if you win $300. Of course, you've usually already spent $500 and up to win the $300 and that's not often at all. The comps are very good here - better than Foxwoods. I always say I'm not going to go to the Sun that often any longer but the day after I leave I want to go back. Oh, service is very good and very friendly. Check-in is ususally swift and whatever you need they'll try to make you happy. After writing this...I want to be there again!
reviews.title: Love, love, love the SUN!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: They have TERRIFIC shows at Mohegan. I've seen so many artists here. There's even free entertainment many nights with top recording artists in the Wolf Den. Just a very fun place where you forget all your troubles and the time of day. Even what day it is! Just go!
reviews.title: Always Fun @ Mohegan Sun

reviews.text: We stayed at the resort all of last summer as well as a few times this summer! It was great. We made several friends we still stay in touch with. Everyone is so nice and friendly, from the Valets, frontdesk attendants and everyone in the shops and restaurants. Without exception, they have all made our stays more enjoyable. The resort and casino are beautiful with many things to do other than gamble, making it a great destination for everyone.
reviews.title: A Non-Gambler's Review

description: Mohegan Sun is the East Coast's premier entertainment, gaming, shopping, meetings and dining destination.
